Sentencas: Proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells (H-SOFCs) with BaZr0.1Ce0.7Y0.2O3-delta as electrolyte were fabricated to couple the removal of nitrogen oxides in power generation technology.
Titulo: Mg-doped La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ cathode as a catalyst for NOx decomposition via H-SOFCs

Sentencas: Specially, a deliberately designed cathode with the composition of La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-delta was prepared to realize this dual function.
Titulo: Mg-doped La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ cathode as a catalyst for NOx decomposition via H-SOFCs

Sentencas: The results indicated that the incorporation of Mg ions in La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8MnO3-delta can improve its ability to adsorb NO and the cathode activity.
Titulo: Mg-doped La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ cathode as a catalyst for NOx decomposition via H-SOFCs

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, when using the NO as oxidant, single cell with La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-delta cathode was able to obtain peak power density of 48 mW cm(-2) and achieve the conversion of NO to N-2 more than 48%.
Titulo: Mg-doped La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ cathode as a catalyst for NOx decomposition via H-SOFCs

Sentencas: These findings suggested that power generation coupling deNO via H-SOFC is possible and La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-delta was a promising cathode for this application.
Titulo: Mg-doped La0.3Sr0.7Mn0.8Mg0.2O3-δ cathode as a catalyst for NOx decomposition via H-SOFCs
